result.execSummary:
The defendant Terry L Micoley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Contact after Domestic Abuse Arrest, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 968.075(5)(a)1.
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
13 days credit only if revoked.
Concurrent with: Count 2

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

Defendant may not possess/consume any alcohol.

Defendant may not enter any bars/taverns.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Same conditions as Count #1, no additional jail time.
Concurrent with: Count #1

records.addlTxt: Defendant Terry L Micoley in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:20 PM. State - resolved. Scholke - plead to count #1 as alleged, plead to count #2 as alleged, #3 - DRI, joint recommendation of a withheld sentence, place on probation for 1 year with conditions of: 10 days in FC jail on count #1, costs, AODA and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, employment/school, no contact with victim (DM). State agrees but makes clarification that the jail time is only on count #1 and State has complied with victim notification requirements. Micoley agrees. Court dismisses and reads in count #3. Micoley pleads NC to counts #1 and #2 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - has complied with victim notification requirement with no response. Scholke makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - asks for time to report for stated reasons (9/16/16). Micoley withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #1 and #2 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year, concurrent to each other, with conditions of: count #1 - 10 days in FC jail - huber allowed - report by 10:00 AM on Friday, 9/16/16 - credit for 13 days only if revoked, costs on each count - paid thru probation, AODA and follow thru, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, submit DNA sample with expunction rights given, right to appeal, adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 14, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Jury trial on September 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terry L Micoley in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:14 AM. Called 16CF113, 16CM45 and 16CM46. Scholke has complaints and understands that the State will be dismissing 16CM45 as it has now been filed as a felony. Scholke waives further reading, requests PH, waives time limits. Court imposes bond at $500.00 signature bond, no consumption of alcohol and no violent contact with D.M. Court dismisses 16CM45. Scholke - offer on 16CM46 has been rejected. State puts offer on the record, 2  years probation with 20 days conditional jail, courts costs on each count, and standard probation conditions. Scholke has gone over Frye with the defendant. Micoley understands. Court continues bond on that case and sets for JT (9/16/16).    Jury trial scheduled for September 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on June 29, 2016 at 10:15 am.
No consumption of alcohol and no contact with DM, RM or GM.

Defendant Terry L Micoley in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Defendant Terry L Micoley in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 16CM45 and 16CM46. Called at 9:35 AM. Lynch has both complaints, waives further reading on both cases, enters NG pleas to all counts. Lynch would like to be heard on the cash bond on 16CM46 - requests signature bond for stated reasons. State - bond on 16CM46 - wants more specifics on where the defendant will reside and needs to avoid 1783 Ogden Avenue and no contact with DM, RM or GM. Lynch does have an address if the court would need it for the defendant.  Court - bond - 16CM46 - $1000 signature bond, no consumption of alcohol, no contact with DM, RM or GM and continues bond on 16CM45  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 29, 2016 at 10:15 am.
